article.title: Here is the 15 sec coding test I used to instantly filter out most applicants

rewrite.title: 15-Second Coding Test Filters Half of Applicants
rewrite.body:
Hiring for remote developer roles often results in an overwhelming influx of applications, making candidate screening a major bottleneck. To address this, a former CTO at MonetizeMore devised a quick, 15-second coding challenge designed to instantly weed out unqualified candidates. The test centers on a deceptively simple snippet containing a subtle logical nuance—a hidden equal sign in a conditional statement—that requires applicants to mentally execute the code rather than rely on copy-pasting or external interpreters.

This approach capitalizes on the premise that skilled programmers can quickly interpret and solve such problems in their heads, while less experienced candidates resort to shortcuts like pasting code into tools such as ChatGPT. By implementing this filter, the CTO was able to immediately eliminate about half of the applicant pool, effectively doubling the efficiency of the recruitment process.

Interestingly, some candidates who initially failed the test reapplied and succeeded, demonstrating that the challenge can also highlight candidates with growth potential. However, the method is not without flaws; incorrect versions of the question posted online led to confusion and false answers, underscoring the risks of publicly sharing test content. Despite these limitations, the test serves as a powerful initial screening tool that significantly reduces hiring time and improves candidate quality for remote developer positions.
